item.title: Lebanon says four months needed for second phase of Hezbollah disarmament
item.content:encoded: Hezbollah rejects calls to dismantle its arsenals north of Litani River, describing pressure to do so as a 'grave sin'.

item.title: Rhode Island shooting: 2 killed, 3 critically injured at Pawtucket ice rink
item.content:encoded: The attacker has also died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound after opening fire at an ice hockey rink in the US.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,454
item.content:encoded: These are the key developments from day 1,454 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

item.title: US deploys 100 soldiers to Nigeria as attacks by armed groups surge
item.content:encoded: US soldiers will not have a combat role and are to operate under full command authority of Nigeria's military.

item.title: One year on, No Other Land co-director says Israeli attacks intensifying
item.content:encoded: Oscar-winning director Hamdan Ballal says his family was attacked despite an Israeli court ruling in their favour.

item.title: US Homeland Security Department’s funding negotiations stall
item.content:encoded: Democrats have called for a ban on immigration agents wearing masks and are pushing for more oversight of operations.

item.title: Drone attack on busy market in Sudan kills at least 28
item.content:encoded: Drone-fired missiles hit when market packed with people, 'exacerbating the humanitarian tragedy', rights group says.

item.title: Robert Duvall, Oscar-winning actor and star of The Godfather, dies aged 95
item.content:encoded: The US actor was nominated for seven Oscars and won one for his role as a washed-up country singer in Tender Mercies.

item.title: Palestinians in Gaza get creative to decorate for Ramadan
item.content:encoded: Despite Israel’s restrictions on materials, many Palestinians are using creative ways to decorate Gaza for Ramadan.

item.title: In Argentina, locals are taking loans to buy food
item.content:encoded: Argentinians are taking on loans, selling their belongings, and living on credit cards to pay for basics including food.

item.title: ‘Joyful yet tearful’: Khalil Hathaleen on charges for Yinon Levi
item.content:encoded: Awdah Hathaleen's brother says Israeli prosecutors’ plan to indict settler Yinon Levi is welcome, but not enough.

item.title: What’s the fallout from Israel’s land grab?
item.content:encoded: Israel takes another step towards annexing the occupied West Bank.

item.title: Supporters mourn Alexey Navalny two years after his death
item.content:encoded: Two years after Alexey Navalny’s death in an Arctic penal colony, supporters gathered at his Moscow grave.

item.title: Bangladesh’s interim leader Yunus steps down as new gov’t set to take over
item.content:encoded: 'Let the practice of democracy continue,' said Yunus, who has overseen country's post-uprising transition since 2024.

item.title: Australia lose to Sri Lanka by eight wickets, staring at T20 World Cup exit
item.content:encoded: Nissanka's unbeaten century batters former champions Australia, who now need other results to go their way to survive.

item.title: Driven by money, pushed by passion: Migrant tea pickers of Kerala, India
item.content:encoded: The migrant workforce is the backbone of the Indian economy, and Kerala is among the biggest beneficiaries.

item.title: Business and limbs destroyed by Israel, Gaza family rebuilds bakery
item.content:encoded: Israeli missiles destroyed not just the Qahman family’s business, but many of their limbs as well.

item.title: Iran launches naval drills ahead of US nuclear talks
item.content:encoded: Iran launched naval drills in the Strait of Hormuz, Persian Gulf and Oman Sea ahead of US-Iran nuclear talks.

item.title: New Israeli housing plan near Jerusalem slammed as ‘disguised annexation’
item.content:encoded: Israel plans to build thousands of settlement homes near Jerusalem, in effect expanding city's borders, activists say.

item.title: Six people killed, 46 injured in Brazil highway bus crash
item.content:encoded: Bus's rear tyre bursts, causing it to overturn on the BR-153 highway.

item.title: Europe’s Israel policy faces a democratic test
item.content:encoded: Citizens have invoked the EU’s own human rights clause to demand suspension of its partnership with Israel.

item.title: Australian ISIL relatives sent back to Syria’s Roj camp after release
item.content:encoded: Thirty-four people returned due to a coordination problem with Damascus expected to be resolved Monday, officials say.

item.title: UN staffers back Francesca Albanese, condemn European ministers for attacks
item.content:encoded: United Staff for Gaza, group of UN staffers, backs the special rapporteur after pro-Israel NGO floats disinformation.

item.title: Israel to restart land registration in West Bank. What that means
item.content:encoded: The land registration process will apply to Area C of the occupied West Bank, which is under complete Israeli control.

item.title: Real Madrid play Benfica in Champions League playoff: Team news and lineups
item.content:encoded: All to know as Benfica host 15-time champion Real Madrid in the opening leg of the UEFA Champions League knockout phase.
